H0.text: Comets are icy objects that have very elliptical orbits around the sun.

H1.text: Meteors are icy objects that have very elliptical orbits around the sun.

H2.text: Asteroids are icy objects that have very elliptical orbits around the sun.

H3.text: Craters are icy objects that have very elliptical orbits around the sun.

A4.text: Most comets are small Solar System bodies with elongated elliptical orbits that take them close to the Sun for a part of their orbit and then out into the further reaches of the Solar System for the remainder.

A5.text: Comets usually have highly eccentric elliptical orbits, and they have a wide range of orbital periods, ranging from several years to potentially several millions of years.
